Reviews.Title: “Dangerous!!!”
Reviews.Author: gipsyaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Strange place, strange staff, strange things happen there. I was robbed in my room and when the police came they said it was not the first time this happened!!! I did not see any video recording system at the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Content with stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dontknow125
Reviews.Content: I have an overall pleasant impression of the hotel. The one minor thing I was not happy with was cold showers! It was a hit or miss. I was the first one to have a cold shower and the next day one of my roommates had one too, but not everyone did. Anyway, that was a small problem. Another thing I wasn't very happy with was being on the 6th floor and climbing the stairs all the time since the elevator only held two people with or without luggage and it wasn't very sturdy as it shook the whole way up to the 6th floor. On a more positve note, I was extremely satisfied with the breakfast I had the time I was there. It was very basic and light, which I guess that is how European breakfasts are. I was also content with my room and having a beautiful balcony outside my window.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cornelia T
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel with clean rooms and a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nuno V
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with average room confitions, top employers, good location, top breakfast (eat as much as you can) !!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about and pricy...”
Reviews.Author: paym01
Reviews.Content: For the price they charged, the room was substandard. The breakfast was also disappointing. It is difficult to come back from the city center if you stay out late. The buses run so seldom and when they do come, they are so full that you cannot get in. So find a place closer, if you plan on staying out late. The connection to the airport was good, as there was a direct train near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ariansumit
Reviews.Content: Carlo Magno is nice and comfortable hotel. It's clean and peaceful place. Hotel is not in Rome Center but not far away from City Center hustle and bustle. Close to the hotel is the bus stop. Every few minutes there is bus that takes you right into City Center. 5 mins bus ride. Hotel is easy to reach from Airport. Take the train from Aiport and get down at station Nomentana. From station it's 10mins walk to hotel Nothing fancy about the hotel. But it's good for the people traveling on a budget vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: aravaioli
Reviews.Content: Personnel is very nice. Hotel looks a bit outdated but, regardless, represents excellent value for the money. I will recommend and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choise”
Reviews.Author: johnwoodam
Reviews.Content: Hi, i've been in this hotel at the beginning of May and i found it very good for the following reasons: 1) Nice room, clean, and silent as clean was the bathroom. Not the bigger bathroom out there but well refurbished in amenities and towels (changed daily). 2) Good staff both at the reception and breakfast room. Professional and helpful. 3) breakfast room is breathtaking as it is at the top floor with a large terrace that has a awesome view over the roofs and beyond up to the far mountains. Breakfast itself was good with many choises in term of quantity and quality: cereals, cakes, yogurt, fresh fruits, croissant, bread and italian coffee to start the day! 4) free internet corner in the lounge and free WI-FI connection allow you to be on line whenever you need. Ask the kind staff for password. 5) City center is not far. A regular bus service just outside connect you with Piazza Venezia or Coliseum in a while. 6) Good choise of restaurant and cafè all around the properties. Also Pizzerias close by. So a positive stay for sure if you ask me. I would suggest to stay here when in Rome. Paula

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: robert9395
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlo Magno hotel with my girlfriend at the beginning of april .We had a double room which was very spacious and clean with safe boxe for our personal belongings. The staffs at the hotel were very friendly and the breakfast in the morning was very good whith cereals, cheese, yoghurts, cakes and croissants. Nice restaurant at the top of the hotel with nice view.Tickets for the bus number 90 are available newsagents at the bottom of the street. The hotel staff will give you all the details the bus took no longer than 15/20 min to reach Piazza Venezia free internet corner in the lobby an free wi fi at the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just a clean bed”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlo Magno while on a Scenic Italy Tour with Trafalgar,and found it to be only adequate in terms of having a clean place to stay. The hotel website suggests taking the FM 1 from the airport to get there,but we did that and found it very confusing to find our way to the hotel upon getting off the train at that particular stop. No signs at stop as to which way to turn to get to the outlying streets. If you were to arrive at night in the dark , it would be totally terrifying to find yourself there. If I had it to do over again I would take the train to Termini and then the bus to the closest stop to the hotel. Bus #90 that would get you the closest to the hotel. It is easy to get to hotel from that stop,and it is worth the trouble of transferring at Termini train station. There are no shops or restaurants to speak of in that area except for 1 which we did not try. Buses are confusing and take at least 20 minutes to get to centre of Rome. Spend a few extra dollars and stay closer to the city centre where you can walk to most sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fix A Few Problems And It's A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: jd1701
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this property in room 204. Way too much noise from street and hallway. Walls paper-thin. Toilet super-loud when flushed and leaked all night until I closed the valve. No functional wifi. Had to go downstairs and sit in particular place, and even then on only 2 days. When I enter the hotel in the evening and ask "Is the wifi working?" and the response from the desk staff is "I hope so" that can't be good! Bathroom design has toilet right up against shower door. Breakfast has zero protein. If you like sugars, this is for you. City information given verbally by desk staff could stand to be more clear and precise. Our rate (€80/per night) was pretty good deal. Room was ample sized, clean, and comfortable. Staff were marginally helpful. Frequent "it is what it is" attitude. Maid service was quite good. Nice rooftop terrace to eat breakfast on when weather permits. Good location for #60 or 90 bus into city. Great pizza by the slice place and gelato nearby. Service, value, rooms, and sleep quality would improve with attention to what I detailed, and if some or all were improved I would recommend this property. As is, I cannot.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: UrbanTeacher
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group while on tour (I'm a high school teacher, I took a group of students to Italy) and had a single room. The room was adequate, the bed was pretty comfortable, but the thing that held the shower head up was broken and it never got fixed. There was construction going on somewhere nearby so it was a bit loud, but that was hardly the hotel's fault. I had a room on an inside courtyard so it wasn't as loud as it could have been. I can't speak about the elevator, because being with a large group I just chose to hike my suitcase up the stairs to the 3rd floor, and walk up to the breakfast room every morning. The breakfast was fine, good selection, although the coffee wasn't very good, so I ended up getting an espresso from the little cafe down the block every morning (1 Euro if you get it in a plastic to-go cup). The best thing about this hotel was the location - I actually liked that it was in a real neighborhood away from the centro storico. There was a great local market nearby where we shopped one day (I bought a lovely bit of cheese there), and it was great for my students to see the "real Rome." There was also a great gelato shop (Oasis) down the street, with prices that were much lower, and product much better, than what we found in the center. Also, the hotel is right on the Via Nomentana, which meant that there is a bus that takes you right to Termini Station. On the way is the paleo-Christian church and mausoleum of Santa Costanza. I'd recommend this hotel to a friend only if the friend has no problem hiking up the stairs as the elevator is unreliable. A couple of my students got stuck in it one night and ended up in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: farf20
Reviews.Content: Apart from the fact that all facilities provided are basic and by no means expected to be provided in a 3 star hotel, the worst part of my stay was that I had to deal with terrible noise at 7am. When I complained to the manager about the noise the only answer I received in a very rude tone was " there are too many guests-there is nothing i can do about it". Using the elevator can make you suffocate and be prepared to wake up at 5am if your room window is broken!!!

Reviews.Title: “All in all and considering the price, a fair accommodation for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: RSMDMuser
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in May 2008 in a double room. The area seems safe and downtown is not too far (you have to take bus, relevant bus station on “Via Nomentana” is very close). The room was decently furnished but small and minibar was out of order. However, main drawback is the noise from road and adjoining rooms: the walls are really thin so that you can hear all. The breakfast room includes a roof terrace but the relevant views are ordinary; the food is average (good cakes, but no hot foods as eggs). I booked via a well known web site and I paid 90€ which appeared to me fair.

Reviews.Title: “Room should have health warning”
Reviews.Author: oscar28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a week long trek through Italy with Traffalgar Tours (do group tours always put tourists in cheap hotel like this one?). How this hotel can rate itself 3 star is anyone's guess, I think it can pass one star! The room we had was poorly furnished, dirty and dangerous! In our narrow bathroom, one has to jump over the toilet WC in order to get to the shower cubical:- the Italian tourist office should stop hotels from offering rooms like this one! The hotel is outskirt of Rome, but is on the northern trunk road so it is easy to take bus into the city centre. We did not eat at the hotel but there are plenty of eateries nearby if you don't want to travel into the city. The staff are reasonably helpful and told us how to take the bus, including buying bus tickets from Tobacco shop down the road. Breakfast on the roof top is quite basic but it is refreshing to be on the roof top after being in a cramped room for the night. I have great doubts about returning to this hotel or to join another group tour.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a European tour for our honeymoon and unfortunately stayed at the Carlo Magno. We were told when we got there that they had just renovated the rooms. This was not true. Everything looked like they slapped paint on and didn't even mask any of the trim. The rooms were okay, but the maid went through our luggage and stole some things (even though we said do not disturb) and when we reported it we were told to WALK to the police station to formally complain. The staff did not apologize they told us that she worked there for 10 years and would never do such a thing. We were then told that the owner wanted to apologize to us directly and kept calling with her ETA. After 4 hours of waiting for her (during dinnertime) we had dinner and she never showed up. The next morning my husband followed up with another manager and was greeted by rudeness! Never stay at the Carlo Magno.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was very disappointed by the services in the Carlo Magno Hotel. The water mixer did not work in my room and in spite of my permanent reminding about it the hotel management did not fix this problem till my check-out. The temperature on the street was about +40C and you can imagine how it was without shower! Besides, on last day after room cleaning they forgot to put a new soap and shampoo. The hotel looks very shabby and requires the renovation. I left the complaint for the director of the hotel but he never answered to it. I do not recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome. Philip Tolmatchev

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo Carlo Magno Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 13 Via Sacco Pastore, 00141 Rome, Italy
